</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4384fda.1503">   <title>CORRECTION: Reminder - 10th ARP Conference CFP Deadline 29 March, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4384fda.1503</link>   <description> Sincere apologies - I pressed send too soon! The deadline for<br>proposals is *March<br>29*, 2015, midnight GMT+6.<br><br>On 12 March 2015 at 15:07, Katia Isakoff &lt;kji@artofrecordproduction.com&gt;<br>wrote:<br><br>&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; CFP 2015 ARP Conference<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; The 10th Art of Record Production Conference:<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; *Cultural Intersections*<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; November 6-8, 2015<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Drexel University<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Philadelphia, PA, USA<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Our conference committee is pleased to invite proposals<br>&gt;&gt; for papers dealing with the following broad thematic areas:<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; A Agency: Content Creators in Record Production<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>>> This stream aims to [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T15:11:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4384fda.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4b0b9715.1503">   <title>CORRECTION: Reminder - 10th ARP Conference CFP Deadline 30 March, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4b0b9715.1503</link>   <description> &gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; CFP 2015 ARP Conference<br>&gt;<br>&gt; The 10th Art of Record Production Conference:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; *Cultural Intersections*<br>&gt;<br>&gt; November 6-8, 2015<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Drexel University<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Philadelphia, PA, USA<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Our conference committee is pleased to invite proposals for papers dealing<br>&gt; with the following broad thematic areas:<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; A Agency: Content Creators in Record Production<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; This stream aims to explore the creative agency within record production.<br>&gt; Who or what is in charge (officially or tacitly)? Is sound recording<br>> inherently collaborative? What are the correlations [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T15:07:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4b0b9715.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ce29c754.1503">   <title>REMINDER: 10th ARP Conference CFP Deadline 30 March, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ce29c754.1503</link>   <description> CFP 2015 ARP Conference<br><br>The 10th Art of Record Production Conference:<br><br>*Cultural Intersections*<br><br>November 6-8, 2015<br><br>Drexel University<br><br>Philadelphia, PA, USA<br><br>Our conference committee is pleased to invite proposals for papers dealing<br>with the following broad thematic areas:<br><br>A Agency: Content Creators in Record Production<br><br>This stream aims to explore the creative agency within record production.<br>Who or what is in charge (officially or tacitly)? Is sound recording<br>inherently collaborative? What are the correlations or disunions associated<br>with the creative process? Who are the future agents in record production?<br>What agency does/will the consumer hold? What is DIY in sound [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T12:15:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ce29c754.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;259e2611.1503">   <title>ASARP Industry Panel at the iFIMPaC 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;259e2611.1503</link>   <description> International Festival for Innovations in Music Production and<br>Composition *Thursday<br>&amp; Friday 12\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd13 March 2015*<br><br>Pick up a full Festival brochure at registration (from 8:15am both days),<br>or download here<br>&lt;http://www.lcm.ac.uk/Documents-Downloads/Festival/IFAI-2015-brochure_FullPorgramme_AW.aspx&gt;<br>.<br><br>Connect with the Festival activity via @LeedsMusic<br>&lt;https://twitter.com/LeedsMusic&gt;, using #IFIMPAC2015.<br><br>The International Festival for Innovations in Music Production and<br>Composition takes place at Leeds College of Music and the City of Leeds<br>from Thursday 12 to Friday 13 March 2015. iFIMPaC is an annual event<br>focusing on practice related innovations in Music Production and<br>Composition. iFIMPaC creates a unique environment for composers, producers,<br>music industry representatives, academics, educators [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T16:20:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;259e2611.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;f47d2e76.1502">   <title>CFP: The 10th Art of Record Production Conference, November 6-8, 2015, Drexel University, Philadelphia, PA, USA </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;f47d2e76.1502</link>   <description> CFP 2015 ARP Conference<br>The 10th Art of Record Production Conference:<br>Cultural Intersections<br>November 6-8, 2015<br>Drexel University<br>Philadelphia, PA, USA<br><br>Our conference committee is pleased to invite proposals for papers dealing with the following broad thematic areas:<br><br>A Agency: Content Creators in Record Production<br><br>This stream aims to explore the creative agency within record production. Who or what is in charge (officially or tacitly)? Is sound recording inherently collaborative? What are the correlations or disunions associated with the creative process? Who are the future agents in record production? What agency does/will the consumer hold? What is DIY in sound [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T11:48:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;f47d2e76.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;bbe1f5d9.1501">   <title>Jobs in York </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;bbe1f5d9.1501</link>   <description> http://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/AKI850/senior-lecturer-in-music-technology/<br><br>http://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/AKI849/lecturer-in-music/<br><br>Jez Wells BMus (Tonmeister) MSc PhD<br>Music Research Centre<br>Department of Music<br>University of York<br>YO10 5DD<br>Email: jez.wells@york.ac.uk<br>Web: http://www.jezwells.org<br><br>Lecturer | Studio Director | Employability Officer | MA Production Pathway Leader<br><br>EMAIL DISCLAIMER http://www.york.ac.uk/docs/disclaimer/email.htm    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-17T18:07:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Zagorski-Thomas</dc:creator> information:<br><br>http://jobs.griffith.edu.au/cw/en/job/501154/senior-lecturer-head-of-music-technology &lt;http://jobs.griffith.edu.au/cw/en/job/501154/senior-lecturer-head-of-music-technology&gt;<br><br>Please feel free to distribute on your networks.<br><br>Best regards,<br>Paul<br><br>Professor Paul Draper<br>Professor in Artistic Research &lt;http://www.griffith.edu.au/music/queensland-conservatorium/staff/professor-paul-draper&gt;, Program Director Doctor of Musical Arts Grey Street South Brisbane Q. 4121 Australia\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Office: S01_3.13 Tel: [+617] 3735 6263 Fax: [+617] 3735 6282<br>Email: p.draper@griffith.edu.au &lt;mailto:p.draper@griffith.edu.au&gt; Skype: p.draper &lt;file:///skype/::p.draper%3Fcall&gt; Web: www.pauldraper.digital &lt;http://www.pauldraper.digital/&gt;   </description> <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ad21c984.1501">   <title>Fwd: [AESeducators] Opened position: Adjunct full time Recording Sciences Professor. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ad21c984.1501</link>   <description> Begin forwarded message:<br><br>&gt; From: &quot;Ing. Alejandro Bidondo&quot; &lt;abidondo@untref.edu.ar&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Dear Sirs:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; At UNTREF University (www.untref.edu.ar), at Dipl. Sound Engineering<br>&gt; Program, we are looking for a Sound Engineer, with not less than a Master<br>&gt; degree on Audio Recording or equivalent, with proved pedagogic skills and<br>&gt; experience on mixing and mastering, sound for film, for Cable TV, for<br>&gt; internet, surround sound, leveling standards and professional audio<br>&gt; installations. Research experience will be desirable.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; The opened position is a full time Adjunct Professor, to teach at all<br>> levels of the Program, including [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-02T17:25:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Zagorski-Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ad21c984.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;63ef12d.1412">   <title>Re: JARP Issue 9 Followup </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;63ef12d.1412</link>   <description> Not sure why I'm getting this email correspondence ?<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Paul<br><br>Paul Borg<br>Music Production &amp; Composition<br>www.paulborgmusic.com<br><br>&gt; On 19 Dec 2014, at 00:01, Katia Isakoff &lt;kji@ARTOFRECORDPRODUCTION.COM&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Hello Eve,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Thank you for your email.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Not sure why this is - the contact link seems to be sending OK. I'll investigate further.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Re: issue #9 - we are aiming to publish in Feb/March 2015 when the review process has completed. The copy editors will be in touch no later than 15 January if there are any submission issues.<br>&gt;<br>> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T00:04:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Borg</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;63ef12d.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ae9095ee.1412">   <title>Re: JARP Issue 9 Followup </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ae9095ee.1412</link>   <description> Hello Eve,<br><br>Thank you for your email.<br><br>Not sure why this is - the contact link seems to be sending OK. I'll investigate further.<br><br>Re: issue #9 - we are aiming to publish in Feb/March 2015 when the review process has completed. The copy editors will be in touch no later than 15 January if there are any submission issues. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T00:01:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;ae9095ee.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9b2537d6.1412">   <title>JARP Issue 9 Followup </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9b2537d6.1412</link>   <description> Dear Katia and List,<br><br>I noticed on the IASPM list this morning a query about the status of the<br>JARP#9 special issue.<br><br>I was wondering this myself... I don't seem to be able to get in contact<br>with the editors via the contact email address for the issue.<br><br>Is it possible to get an update on how the editorial process is going? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T09:24:47+11:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Eve Klein</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9b2537d6.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9c6b4da9.1411">   <title>Funded PhD: Machine learning applied to sound synthesis and content creation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9c6b4da9.1411</link>   <description> Dear all, A funded PhD place is available to work within the Centre for Digital Music on the subject of machine learning applied to sound synthesis and content creation. Description below, and full details (including how to apply) at http://www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk/phd/research-topics/funded Please feel free to distribute this to anyone who might be interested. Thanks. Dr. Josh Reiss Reader in Audio Engineering Centre for Digital Music Queen Mary University of London Fully-funded PhD studentship: Machine learning applied to sound synthesis and media content creation Applications are invited from all nationalities for a funded PhD Studentship starting January 2015 within the Centre for [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-22T14:51:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joshua Reiss</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9c6b4da9.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;44c332c0.1411">   <title>Call for Papers reminder, 138th Audio Engineering Society Convention </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;44c332c0.1411</link>   <description> Apologies if you receive multiple copies<br><br>Call for Papers, 138th Audio Engineering Society Convention<br><br>Warsaw, Poland, May 7-10, 2015<br><br>http://www.aes.org/events/138/authors/138thCallForPapers.pdf    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-22T14:48:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joshua Reiss</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;44c332c0.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;19400e9e.1411">   <title>Funded PhD: Machine learning applied to sound synthesis and content creation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;19400e9e.1411</link>   <description> Dear all, A funded PhD place is available to work within the Centre for Digital Music on the subject of machine learning applied to sound synthesis and content creation. Description below, and full details (including how to apply) at http://www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk/phd/research-topics/funded Please feel free to distribute this to anyone who might be interested. Thanks. Dr. Josh Reiss Reader in Audio Engineering Centre for Digital Music Queen Mary University of London Fully-funded PhD studentship: Machine learning applied to sound synthesis and media content creation Applications are invited from all nationalities for a funded PhD Studentship starting January 2015 within the Centre for [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-20T10:54:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joshua Reiss</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;19400e9e.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;bef3afde.1410">   <title>Open Lecture and Book Launch at the University of West London </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;bef3afde.1410</link>   <description> Dear All<br>Apologies for cross-posting and self promotion - and for including many of you who might not be near to London.<br>We are holding an open lecture and drinks reception at the University of West London to launch my new book, The Musicology of Record Production, at 6.30pm on Thursday 30th October (address below). In this talk, I will use a range of examples to explore how theoretical knowledge and practice as research can help to bridge the divide between the vocational and the traditionally academic. Drawing on recordings by artists as varied as classical pianist, Andrei Gavrilov, jazz [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T23:49:15+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Zagorski-Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;bef3afde.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;63eb909f.1410">   <title>Call for Papers, 138th Audio Engineering Society Convention </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;63eb909f.1410</link>   <description> Apologies if you receive multiple copies<br><br>Call for Papers, 138th Audio Engineering Society Convention<br>Warsaw, Poland, May 7\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd10, 2015<br>http://www.aes.org/events/138/authors/138thCallForPapers.pdf   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-14T02:45:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joshua Reiss</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;63eb909f.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4d28734f.1410">   <title>Fwd: Job in music technology </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4d28734f.1410</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>&gt; From: Rupert Till &lt;r.till@HUD.AC.UK&gt;<br>&gt; Date: 13 October 2014 21:01:39 GMT+01:00<br>&gt; To: IASPMLIST@liverpool.ac.uk<br>&gt; Subject: Job in music technology<br>&gt; Reply-To: Subscribers of iaspm list &lt;IASPMLIST@liverpool.ac.uk&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; There is a music technology lecturing post available at our university that might interest some of you. Please circulate to any networks or individuals who might be interested. Could well lead to longer term employment.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; http://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/AJT838/lecturer-in-music-technology-and-production/<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Cheers<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Rupert<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Dr. Rupert Till MA FHEA<br>&gt; Reader in Music<br>> Chair of International Association for the Study [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-13T21:39:49+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;4d28734f.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;547a61a8.1410">   <title>John Foxx and Steve D'Agostino New Album and Live Performance at the BFI </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;547a61a8.1410</link>   <description> &gt; Dear friends and colleagues,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I'm very proud to announce that my label and studio partner Steve D'Agostino will be performing his new album with John Foxx - Evidence of Time Travel at the BFI on 21 November, 2014. They will be joined by visual artist Karborn.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Further info. and links below. Please feel free to circulate to your students.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Hope to see some of you there!<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Best wishes,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Katia<br>&gt; ALTERSONIC SOUND<br>&gt; www.altersonicsound.com<br>&gt;<br>&gt; View this email in your browser<br>&gt;<br>> FOXX/D'AGOSTINO Evidence Of Time Travel [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-07T18:44:59+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;547a61a8.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9139f17a.1410">   <title>AN UPDATE ON THE 9TH ART OF RECORD PRODUCTION CONFERENCE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9139f17a.1410</link>   <description> AN UPDATE ON THE 9TH ART OF RECORD PRODUCTION CONFERENCE:<br><br>Just a quick reminder that the deadline for registration and for getting the conference fee refunded is 15 October.<br><br>The program is now published at the website: http://artofrecordproduction.com/index.php/component/content/article?id=224<br><br>As you'll see from the program, three panels are confirmed:<br><br>OPENING PANEL: RECORD PRODUCTION IN THE INTERNET AGE<br>Panel Members: Amanda Bayley, Bath Spa University, Joe Bennett, Bath Spa University, Stan Hawkins, University of Oslo,Arnt Maas\ufffd\ufffd, University of Oslo, and Paul Th\ufffd\ufffdberge, Carleton University.<br>Moderator: Katia Isakoff [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-02T14:15:04+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Zagorski-Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9139f17a.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;24e3c5d9.1409">   <title>Quincy Jones Performance + Q&A at the RCM - Sunday 28 Sept' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;24e3c5d9.1409</link>   <description> Dear UK members,<br><br>Please see below - feel free to circulate to students and colleagues!<br><br>Quincy Jones this Sunday at the Royal College of Music<br><br>There is a last minute Evening with Quincy Jones this Sunday at the Royal College of Music in the Britten Theatre (300 capacity).<br><br>There will be a 17 piece house band with Hamish Stuart, Jocelyn Brown, Beverley Knight, Mica Paris, Kenny Thomas and other guest vocalists followed by a live interview on stage with Quincy by Paul Gambaccini and then an audience Q&amp;A. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-26T17:15:35+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;24e3c5d9.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9a9059a3.1409">   <title>ASARP and iFIMPaC Joint Call for Papers - Keynote: Trevor Wishart </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9a9059a3.1409</link>   <description> INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL FOR INNOVATIONS IN MUSIC PRODUCTION AND COMPOSITION<br><br>*Thursday &amp; Friday 12\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd13 March 2015*<br><br>Keynote speaker and artist: *Trevor Wishart* (biog<br>&lt;http://www.lcm.ac.uk/Documents-Downloads/Festival/2015/ifaibiog-trevor_wishart.aspx&gt;<br>)<br>Second Keynote: TBC<br><br>*The International Festival for Innovations in Music Production and<br>Composition takes place at Leeds College of Music and the City of Leeds<br>from Thursday 12 to Friday 13 March 2015.* iFIMPaC is an annual event<br>focusing on practice related innovations in Music Production and<br>Composition. iFIMPaC creates a unique environment for composers, producers,<br>music industry representatives, academics, educators and students to<br>discuss their compositional, pedagogical and production work as<br>practice-led research. This year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-25T13:51:35+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;9a9059a3.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;e2cf7df8.1409">   <title>Announcement from IASPM: Andrew Goodwin Memorial Prize </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;e2cf7df8.1409</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>http://www.iaspm.org.uk/andrew-goodwin-memorial-prize/<br>Andrew Goodwin Memorial Prize<br>&lt;http://www.iaspm.org.uk/andrew-goodwin-memorial-prize/&gt;<br><br>*Andrew Goodwin* was a key figure in the development of popular music<br>studies. His background was in media and cultural studies: he received his<br>Ph.D. in Cultural Studies from the University of Birmingham and taught for<br>many years in the Department of Media Studies at the University of San<br>Francisco. He was a pioneer of the scholarly analysis of music video (in<br>his book, *Dancing in the Distraction Factory. Music Television and Popular<br>Culture*, for example, which drew on his previous work on television) and<br>an astute critic of the use [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-17T17:47:57+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;e2cf7df8.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;e1ced39b.1409">   <title>JARP CALL FOR ARTICLES - *EXTENDED DEADLINE* - 31 OCTOBER 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;e1ced39b.1409</link>   <description> *Journal on the Art of Record Production ISSN: 1754-9892*<br><br>*CALL FOR ARTICLES*<br><br>*Issue #9*<br><br>*The Good Old Days? Negotiating Quality, Mythology and Technostalgia in<br>Contemporary Music Production*<br><br>The Journal on the Art of Record Production invites articles, provocations<br>and practitioner interviews for Issue #9: *The Good Old Days? Negotiating<br>Quality, Mythology and Technostalgia in Contemporary Music Production. *In<br>a recent *Audio Pro International* provocation, columnist, engineer and<br>mixer Ian Dowling rejects the notion of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Good Old Days\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and rails<br>against what he sees as a stifling of innovation caused by a slavish<br>re-modelling of the past in today\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds recording [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-08T19:53:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katia Isakoff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASARP;e1ced39b.1409</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
